[

Sales Executive

Company Name Tiger Nutrition Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 30 minutes ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you passionate about fitness and supplements? \xa0Are you a huge fan of EHPlabs and OxyShred? And, if you have great communications and sales skills, this is your DREAM JOB.

\xa0

Tiger Nutrition is the exclusive distributor of US sports nutrition brands, EHPlabs and Blessed Protein for Australia and New Zealand. Located in Ultimo, Sydney, our global head office is searching for a talented Sales Executive to join our expanding team.

\xa0

Our brands

EHPlabs is renowned for taking the social media world by storm with almost 1 million followers on Instagram, and some of the most famous fitness models / athletes in the world (giving us a global social media reach of over 50 million fans and followers - making us one of the largest fitness brands and social media marketing companies in the world).

\xa0

Blessed Plant Protein is the sister brand of EHPlabs, and has a key focus on providing health and lifestyle nutrition products to the vegan, vegetarian, dairy-free, lactose-free, wholefood all-natural market.

\xa0

We are also excited to be pioneering the health and fitness industry through technology and app development. \xa0We're constantly looking at new ways of reaching our audiences in a more effective and meaningful, and technology development is our conduit for this.

\xa0

If you want a super positive and exciting place to develop your career, \xa0watch video: https://youtu.be/qnZv3WyJt50

\xa0

The role

As a Tiger Nutrition Sales Executive, you will report to the National Sales Manager and your responsibilities will include:

  • Generating sales for a portfolio of retail supplement/nutrition stores and gym accounts

  • Building and maintaining the relationships with your account portfolio

  • Assisting with the processing orders and taking payments from our accounts;

  • Delivering exceptional customer service on a day-to-day basis

  • Working closely with the senior sales team to implement strategic sales campaigns;

  • Assisting with marketing and retail store promotional activations to encourage sales growth and development;

  • Helping to maintain sales and communication records;

  • Liaising with our 3rd party warehouse.

\xa0

About you

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • An in-depth understanding and passion for sports supplements, especially all EHPlabs & Blessed Protein products

  • You will have excellent sales skills/acumen, charisma, energy and emotional intelligence;

  • You will have experience in customer service and nurturing relationships;

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, high attention to detail;

  • You will be honest, down to earth, dynamic and a real team player;

  • A natural doer, you will thrive on working both collaboratively and autonomously.

\xa0

What's On Offer:

  • Exciting, passionate, hard-working and engaging environment

  • Dynamic workplace where no two days are the same!

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure/ Free Product Allowances / Free Gym Access

\xa0

This role offers the successful candidate the opportunity to carve a role for themselves within the health and fitness industry. This is a unique offering that will allow you to learn directly from an experienced, industry leading sales team.

\xa0

Next steps

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please send through your resume and academic transcript, as well as a brief paragraph about which role appeals to you and why to careers@dashdigitalmedia.com

\xa0

We appreciate your understanding that only successful applicants will be contacted, and that due to the high number of applicants we receive, we are unable to reply to individual phone calls or emails.

STOCK\xa0 ADMINISTRATOR & DISPATCH | AVSTEV GROUP

An opportunity exists to join the AVSTEV Group, a fast passed business distributing luxury Swiss watches & accessories, based on Edgecliff Sydney.\xa0


The role’s primary purpose is to put into place processes that streamline the stock administration, including receipt & dispatch of international shipments, and ensure the smooth running of all inventory.


  • Ensure stock & shipments are received & processed correctly for all AVSTEV Group brands.
  • Record, report & manage stock levels.
  • Co-ordinate regular stock takes.
  • Invoice all orders through the ACCPAC system.
  • Ensure stock adjustments are processed as required.\xa0
  • Record all stock movement - receipt, dispatch and storage.
  • Prepare outgoing shipments & dispatch orders.
  • Answers & replying to telephone/web enquiries.
  • Build & refine all processes relating to the management of inventory, invoicing & dispatch.
  • Take responsibility for all administration related to the inventory of AVSTEV Group.

\xa0

The ideal candidate will have exceptional administrative skills, and have previous experiencing receiving, recording & dispatching stock.


They will be dynamic in their approach to building & refining processes to create the most efficient systems relating to stock, and have the ability to work thoroughly in a busy office.

886372058:
[

Product Owner - Technology

Company Name THE ICONIC Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 70 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

THE ICONIC is a truly unique brand. We entered the market in 2011 with the vision of defining the future of fashion retail. Since then we have created a brand known throughout Australia by connecting 20-35yr old shoppers with the best fashion and sports product through the most inspiring and rewarding shopping experience.

THE ICONIC stands for benchmark-setting experiences (3HR delivery, access to over 700 top brands, market-leading shopping app), for impassioned communities (connecting Australians fashion and sports lovers through digital innovation), and for our love of the newest in fashion from our 700+ leading local and international brands. We want to inspire Australians and New Zealanders to constantly explore new sides of their identity, and have a whole lot of fun doing it.

  • "We Dream Big” – “You will challenge the status quo, bringing passion, innovation and creativity to the wider ICONIC team.
  • “We Are True to our Customers” – you will be inherently passionate about customer impact, both external and internal customers, and will constantly challenge yourself and the team to deliver more customer value
  • “We Get Things Done”\xa0– you do not want to work in a cumbersome organisation, you want to work in an agile high-growth company. You lead with the right balance of planning and pragmatism.
  • "We are Stronger Together”\xa0- You will be part of an experienced team working collaboratively to inspire the broader organisation towards a united vision


You will be a key part of the Product Management team within the overall Internal Product team at THE ICONIC. The team's mission is to imagine and build out the technology that drives THE ICONIC, specifically the applications and integrations that help us deliver huge numbers of items on time every day to every corner of Australia and New Zealand from our Fulfillment Centre.


It is a new role due to expansion in the tech team supporting fulfillment. The primary responsibility will be to successfully deliver impactful internal products that help our staff (and robots) get stuff done quickly and intelligently. These internal products will allow our staff to focus on delivering value, without resorting to manual processes, or wrestling with less than great technology. Success means observing how things get done today, and listening very carefully to our users (staff). You will need to intimately understand their work, and working with them and your development squad you’ll imagine new and better ways for them to get stuff done. All this within an environment that continues to consistently scale rapidly every year, while reliably maintaining the ability to have an order on a courier vehicle within 10 minutes. You will be successful if you build positive trusting relationships with your internal stakeholders and development squad, by delivering the agreed backlog on time.


You will be able to demonstrate substantial previous practical success in Agile - ideally you will be a certified Scrum Product Owner. You will be able to demonstrate experience in structuring and executing on complex software product backlogs. You will have a good understanding of, or experience in, Lean and understand how it can be applied to product development.

You will be able to demonstrate the ability to manage high performing and demanding (but fair) stakeholders. You will have good commercial instincts and understand how to balance competing requirements.


This is an unusual product management role because the users you are building for are all in the building. It creates an unusual opportunity to engage closely with users in a way that is harder to achieve consistently with "normal" software or SaaS product management roles.

The challenges will be:
Quickly learning new domains that you may not have experience of.
Working on high profile internal products to solve significant headaches for specific teams and groups of users and that represent serious challenges for those teams.


Our Fulfillment Centre is based in the Western Suburbs (Yennora) with plenty of free parking and good transport links. We expect you will need to spend 3 days or more there and the rest of the time in the CBD.


Key Attributes:

  • 8+ years of software / SaaS / technology product management experience.

  • Ability to read API documentation and understand what the API can do.

  • Analytical - Previous experience working with Data Scientists is highly desirable.

  • Computer Science or Engineering degree or work experience a plus.

  • Experience working in agile environments.

  • A head for business and operational metrics.

  • Experienced and comfortable in leading negotiations, workshops.

  • Proactive, always available for the team.

  • Collaborative nature.

  • Entrepreneurial mindset, adaptable and proactive within a fast-changing landscape.

  • Highly motivated, positive approach. You favour collaboration over being competitive.

  • Deep understanding of story mapping, feature prioritisation methodologies.

  • Understanding of how features and functionality leads to business value.

  • Ability to bring previous learning to the role.

  • Welcome visitors to Support Office

Company Name Vocus Group Limited Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Job description

As the fourth largest Telco in Australia, Vocus Group continues to grow and we are looking for an experienced Application Engineer to be part of the Network Engineering team. \xa0

You will be instrumental in the development of innovative features for our OSS applications and network management tools. You will be developing using C#, VB.Net, Java, Python, SOAP and JSON REST API’s.

The day to day


  • Analysis – Review user stories and feature requests
  • Collaboration – Work with your teammates (developers, scrum master and analysts) to build-out requirements
  • Design – Convert user stores and requirements into your own DB, API and UI designs
  • Development – Build your designs for DB schema, modules, APIs and UIs
  • Testing – Build unit tests for your features and peer review your teammates features
  • Maintenance – Upgrade dependencies, fix bugs, clean code and improve system performance & architecture
  • Document – Write self-documenting code, add code comments and keep wiki updated
  • Code Review – Merge and review code changes for structure and quality
  • DevOps – Work with IT and Network operations staff to assist with automation tasks


What you need to bring to the table

  • 5 yrs + development experience with Node JS and front end JavaScript frameworks.
  • BSc in Computer Science or equivalent
  • Excellent knowledge of C# and web API conventions
  • Excellent understanding of software engineering principles and SDLC
  • Ability to quickly learn and develop with frontend JS frameworks – Angular…
  • Strong knowledge of a NoSQL & SQL DB such as Mongo DB, MySQL, Postgres, SQL Server, Oracle…
  • Solid experience of source control and build tools e.g. GIT, SVN, TypeScript
  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to visualise use cases and user stories
  • Enthusiasm for open source technologies – Elasticsearch, Ansible, Grafana
  • Knowledge of IT platforms and networking vendors – DNS, LDAP, Mail, JUNOS, Cisco IOS
  • Previous experience in an OSS environment desirable.

884754674:
[

Identity Engineer

Company Name Versent Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Versent is a rapidly growing Cloud Consulting organisation, specialising in AWS. We have offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth and Singapore and have grown to over 250 people in just four years! We believe in bringing craftsmanship back to technology, because as technology artisans, we passionately care about the quality outcomes we leave behind.

Our Security practice has been kicking goals and because of this, we're looking to grow the team with another Identity Engineer / Senior Identity Engineer.

Our Identity Engineers work within project teams, normally made up of Microservices and Cloud Engineers along with a Principal/s to lead the engagement. Focused on key deliverables and following a 'common sense' Agile methodology to maintain consistency and team velocity.

You will be working with high profile, enterprise level customers on a variety of projects. We need someone who can deal with ambiguity, is ready to hit the ground running and works well within a team.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Experience working with IAM tools like Ping, Oracle, Sailpoint, CA API/Layer 7
  • Strong understanding of published standards (eg XACML, OIDC, OAuth2, SAML)
  • Know your way around Java - don't need you to be a full blown developer but you need to be able to add adapters and extensions easily
  • Having worked with PingFed would be a huge bonus, not essential
  • Great written and verbal communication skills

Benefits:

At the core of what we do, we're an engineering company. We value our people more than commercials and put culture at the centre of everything.

We do weekly internal tech meetups with food and drinks, host game nights (poker, Dungeons and Dragons, table tennis comps etc.), organise Hackathons, pay for your AWS training and certifications, and other relevant certs (if it's something you want to do).

We have many social events, often supporting charity initiatives such as TourXOz and RUOK Day. We also have family functions such as lawn bowls and State of Origin nights. We have a paid parental leave program.

We embrace the notion of Versent as a Family, working together to achieve outstanding success.

We have flexible working hours and a culture based on respect, trust and collaboration.

Salary is dependent purely on experience.


WHY WE'RE DIFFERENT

You know, work doesn't have to feel like work. In fact, we don't want it to. That's why we've cultivated an environment based on creativity. Because when people who care about their craft are given the freedom to explore possibilities without restriction, amazing things can happen.

OUR CULTURE

No cool cliques, just hard-working humans generating ideas and devising solutions in a creative, collaborative work space. Professional but not corporate, we believe success is achieved through strong leadership (without interference from middle-management) and an autonomous working environment backed by the moral support of like-minded peers.

Versent Values and Behaviors

  • People: We believe in a positive team with family spirit, because life is to short for anything else.
  • Customer: We create remarkable experiences for customers and treat them as you would wish to be treated.
  • Quality: Be Artisans who care for their craft and lead change through continuous improvement.
  • Reliability: Do what we say we will do when we say we will do it, every time.
  • Transparency: Full disclosure, integrity and honesty in all things.
  • Reciprocate: Give back and assist as much as possible, whenever possible.

Contact the job poster

Paul Jenkins

Supporting the growth of Versent by engaging the best talent. API, Microservices, DevOps, AWS, Digital Security and more

Enterprise Account Manager

Company Name Kloud Solutions Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 7 minutes ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Kloud we specialise in the design and implementation of cloud-scale applications as well as in helping our customers migrate existing applications to public cloud platforms.


This is a role about creating and driving strong opportunities and momentum across your customer base. You will have a self-starter mindset and thrive on engaging and talking to all levels of customer stakeholders.\xa0 Focus on strong business management will be an important part of the role, including planning, forecasting, revenue achievement and customer satisfaction.


The successful candidate will be prepared to assist through multiple stages of a customer engagement cycle, including


  • Generating new business in new and existing enterprise accounts
  • Leveraging your existing relationships within the Commercial Services sector
  • Ownership in the tendering and proposal process
  • Driving the sales process from identification through to close and ongoing management
  • Working closely with State Manager on customer strategy, account planning, service delivery and reporting on sales activities as required – status reports, management and planning of sales opportunities
  • Developing and delivering effective presentations for clients and senior level executives
  • Meeting and exceeding agreed revenue, profitability and customer satisfaction targets
  • Contributing to a strong team centric morale – driven through a close engagement with your consultants

Key Skills and Experience


Beyond a passion for sales and senior experience selling consulting led services, candidates should also possess the following:

Discover a great place to work at Harvey Norman. If you like to work in a fast paced, exciting and challenging environment, the Harvey Norman IT (HNIT) Operations Group could be the place for you.

We are seeking an experienced Automation Specialist to join our dynamic, responsive IT Operations team, to support the Corporate Offices, as well as stores, in Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, Singapore and Malaysia.


The primary responsibilities of the role include:


  • Identify, investigate and deliver continuous improvement opportunities across all disciplines in IT Operations by driving increased automation across the environment
  • Lead the push to improve standardisation and consistency, improve reliability and availability of the systems, and reduce the time required to provision IT resources
  • Instigate and manage a progressive training and cross-skilling program for operational staff in automation practices and solutions in order to remove key staff risks, and ensure consistency

  • Join our Global Training Team!

Partners in Performance (PIP) is a dynamic, highly successful global management consulting firm with its global head office located in Sydney. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver rapid sustainable results in performance. Our Firm has real scale and a demonstrated track record with reach across Australia, New Zealand, South East Asia, Africa, North and South America, Europe and the Middle East. As a Firm, we are about Unleashing Potential in our clients and our people.



THE ROLE


We have an exceptional junior career opportunity for a professional with strong administrative experience to join our Global Training Team based in Sydney. This is a busy and varied role with a primary focus on coordinating the firms’ global training programme for PIP employees.


Role responsibilities will include: -

\xa0

  • Coordinate and send out all training invitations to employees
  • Manage the local Learning and Development calendar
  • Work with broader L&D team to develop training schedules and communications

  • Prepare presentations/training templates and training material for facilitators

  • Manage training records
  • Ad hoc administrative and broader firm support as required



THE SELECTION CRITERIA


To succeed in this role, you do not necessarily need to have a background in L&D or HR; but you will have solid administration skills, computer proficiency and thrive in a fast-paced deadline driven environment.

  • Experience supporting a team, projects and/or events will be highly regarded
  • Degree qualified

  • Comfort working as part of a broader virtual team and capable of liaising with stakeholders remotely
  • A passion for growth, innovation and continuous improvement

JOIN US


This opportunity provides great scope for future development and continual drive for improvement, which requires a self-starter to get things done. \xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Full time, fixed term contract until 31st March 2019

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 An ideal entry level role for the not-for-profit sector

Redkite:

Redkite supports children and young people with cancer and their families by providing real and practical support through the cancer journey – from the very moment of diagnosis, throughout treatment and when families return home to their community. Redkite is one of Australia’s leading national childhood cancer support charities, and has an experienced and passionate team.

\xa0

The role:

The Corporate Partnership Coordinator plays an integral role in engaging Redkite’s biggest retail corporate partners. Ideal for professionals with strong relationship management skills and an ability to engage stakeholders, this role will see you visiting store teams and ensuring they feel inspired to support children and young people with cancer and acknowledged for their generosity.

\xa0

As the main point of contact for our partners’ store team members in New South Wales and Australian Capital Territory, the Corporate Partnership Coordinator provides important support to their fundraising activities. This role involves regular travel, suiting proactive candidates with excellent time management skills who enjoy meeting new people. Essential to success will be the ability to work and travel independently, while also contributing to a supportive and collaborative interstate team.

\xa0

While prior not-for-profit fundraising experience is advantageous, this is an ideal entry level role for the not-for-profit sector. This is an excellent opportunity to develop and grow your career by stepping into a challenging and varied role.

\xa0

The successful candidate will have:

Job description

This is a re-advertised role and previous applicants need not apply


Full Time, 1 Year Fixed Term Contract\xa0

An exciting and challenging role exists with a fast growing dynamic organisation. Provide a high quality customer service and administrative support .


The College of Law is looking for a talented, dynamic Client Services Officer to join the team at our Sydney Elizabeth Street Office.


The Client Services Officer is responsible for a range of high quality administrative and customer relationship\xa0 support ensuring efficient and effective use of all resources to provide\xa0 high quality and relaible data, documentation and course materials.


The key areas the Client Services Officer will be involved in are:

\xa0

  • Ensuring effective enrolment/registrant service delivery.

\xa0

  • Maintaining effective customer relationships by exhibiting and displaying college expected behaviours and values, and professionalism.

\xa0

  • Ensuring reliability of collected data for marketing and reporting purposes through accurate collection and recording of information,

\xa0

  • Build positive and sustainable relationships with colleagues, stakeholders and customers.


  • Contributes to the ongoing development and improvement of the department processes and systems.

Experience, Skills and Attributes


  • 2 years' experience in a similar service environment like call centre\xa0
  • Compentency in Microsoft Office especially Word, Excel and Outlook; competency in CRM systems is advantageous
  • Experience in teritiary education admissions or a legal background is ideal but not essential
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills particularly via email
  • A strong orientation to the provision of a high level of customer service, including empathy with an ability to communicate and demonstrate understanding of the other's point of view
  • Articulate and methodical with ability to problem solve and use own initiative
  • Ability to adjust readily to pressures and changes in the work environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative team environment


If you are interested in being part of a growing Australia and New Zealand operation, then visit our website http://www.collaw.edu.au/careers/ for more information. Please send your application including a CV and cover letter to recruitment@collaw.edu.au.

\xa0

Advertisement closes COB\xa0 Friday 5th October 2018

Job description

Leading Hand Electrician

The Engineering Department at the Monash Medical Centre requires an Leading Hand Electrician to manage the electrical department and electrical infrastructure repairs and maintenance.

About The Role

As a member of the Monash Medical Centre Engineering team, the successful applicant will have a “hands on” approach to work, with the ability to communicate to internal stakeholders and contractors. With a Building Services trade background and an “A Class” electrical license, you will be responsible to ensure the hospital is compliant with all relevant regulations.

A customer service approach is essential and previous hospital experience in a similar role will be an advantage.

Monash Health is the largest health service in Melbourne and provides comprehensive integrated health care services to over 750,000 people in the south-eastern suburbs of metropolitan Melbourne across five major sites and twenty eight minor sites.

Monash Health Will Offer
  • competitive salary
  • salary packaging
  • friendly and supportive culture

Monash health provides a world of healthcare across south eastern Melbourne, uniquely integrating primary, secondary and tertiary health services as well as world-renowned research and teaching facilities. We employee more than 15,000 staff who work across 40 care locations. In Monash Health your own growth and development is important and with us you can really be your best. For more information please visit www.monashhealth.org

Project Managers

Company Name Chandler Macleod Group Company Location Adelaide, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 86 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

An opportunity has presented itself for an experienced Project Managers to manage multiple projects within the state government. There are multiple opportunities available for a 9-month casual assignment commencing early October.


Reporting to the Manager, Software Operations your key responsibilities will be:

  • Coordination of project resources and deadlines;

  • Scheduling and facilitating stakeholder and steering committee meetings;

  • Management and publication of projects schedules and project reporting;

  • Liaison with vendors, third party and external government agencies;

  • Management of project budgets, timelines, risks and deliverables; and

  • Other project related duties as directed.

  • Some out-of-hours work may be required in order to meet critical deadlines.

\xa0

Required Experience and Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience working as a project manager in a corporate or ideally a government environment on significant business projects.

  • Must be willing to submit a police check prior to commencement

  • Experience in supporting a procurement process from specification of business requirements through to management of supplier product delivery.

  • Experience of software project management and requirements gathering.

  • Demonstrated skills in issue and risk management to ensure all stakeholders know possible problems and available mitigation measures.

  • Proficient use of project management scheduling software and understanding of scheduling techniques to deliver a project in an agreed timeframe.

  • Demonstrated ability to work in a team to provide timely delivery of agreed products.

  • Experience in managing implementation of bespoke software and hardware as well as required interfaces to other corporate software systems.

  • Demonstrated regular reporting and presentation of information to project stakeholders.

\xa0

ICT Infrastructure within the department are supported by:

  • Windows based Servers;

  • zOS Mainframe;

  • MS-SQL, Oracle, IDMS and Adabas databases;

  • Java applications for mobile computing;

  • Communications network, including mobile computing providing connectivity for vehicles and locations across South Australia.

    \xa0

This position is commencing early October until end of June 2019. Hourly pay rate will be negotiated depending of level of experience for the role. If you have the skills and experience required, please apply now.


Chandler Macleod is partnering with candidates and clients alike to unleash their full potential. Successfully working with leading operations throughout Australia, the team at Chandler Macleod is actively sourcing and placing candidates in the right roles using our 'Best Fit Methods'

The Campaign Administrator role provides marketing administration support to the Campaign Strategy team that enables the efficient and effective delivery of the fundraising strategy key objectives and contributes to the achievement of revenue targets.

In this role you will oversee the co-ordination of all marketing activity and work closely with both the Digital Transformation and Campaign Strategy teams to ensure an effective campaign delivery.

  • Formal qualifications in Marketing/Communications/Business or related discipline
  • Understanding of marketing principles across offline and online platforms
  • Experience working with fundraising, community associations, not-for-profit / membership organisations
  • Knowledge of direct mail, printer and mail house end to end processes, customer service principles and management reporting
  • Working understanding of a CRM and/or database and data segmentation
  • Knowledge of fundraising protocols and/or legislation
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft / Adobe Suites
